title: Ratings & Reviews FAQs
content:

Feature OverviewRatings & Reviews FAQs
Patient Feedback
Ratings & Reviews FAQs
23 min read
Thrive Plan
This guide is a compilation of some of the most frequently asked questions around Jane‚Äôs Ratings & Reviews feature. Have a read through these, and stay tuned for some links at the bottom of this Guide to some additional resources to help you get set up and on your way with Ratings and Reviews.
Access and Permissions
What access level is required to enable Ratings and Reviews?
Do all staff members have permission to see practitioners‚Äô internal ratings and reviews?
Will my account be opted-out of Ratings and Reviews by default?
Arriving Appointments
Yikes, I just unarrived - then rearrived the same appointment for a patient. Will they get two surveys?
If I arrive an appointment early, will Jane send the survey to the client earlier too?
What if I arrive then unarrive a
past
appointment? Is this any different?
Settings for Multi-Practitioner Clinics
If ‚Äúrequest feedback after 5 visits‚Äù is selected, and if the patient sees multiple practitioners at the clinic, does Jane know the difference between visit #5 with Practitioner A vs. Practitioner B?
If ‚ÄúRequest Visit after Initial Visit‚Äù is selected, does Jane know that it is a unique initial visit with Practitioner A vs. Practitioner B?
Receiving Surveys and Opting-Out
Does the clinic have the option to opt-out a specific patient from receiving surveys from the clinic?
Do individual patients have the option to opt-out of receiving surveys?
I‚Äôm a guardian/parent of a minor and I‚Äôd like to provide feedback to the clinic for my child‚Äôs appointment. Will I receive this email?
Google Reviews
I have Google Reviews enabled for my clinic. Will Jane automatically help me post my reviews to Google as well?
I‚Äôm a practitioner at a multi-disciplinary clinic. I‚Äôm not allowed to use Google Reviews as per my Regulatory Body‚Äôs Standards of Practice, but others in my clinic are allowed to. What does this mean for our clinic‚Äôs Ratings & Reviews settings?
I‚Äôm using Google Reviews. If a client‚Äôs feedback is posted to Google as well, will the clinic or staff member be notified?
Can I customize my text so that my patient can read my personalized note before proceeding to post on Google?
If I have Google Reviews enabled, does my client get prompted to leave a review for any star rating from 1-5?
Does my regulatory body allow me to publicly market patient testimonials online?
General
Why didn‚Äôt my patient receive a Ratings email?
Can I manually send a rating email to a patient?
Access and Permissions
What access level is required to enable Ratings and Reviews?
You‚Äôll need to be the Account Owner or have Full Access to enable Ratings & Reviews within Settings.
Do all staff members have permission to see practitioners‚Äô internal ratings and reviews?
Only
Full Access & Administrative/All Billing
have access to see each staff member‚Äôs ratings and reviews at the clinic. Here‚Äôs a nifty little table we put together to display the Role and Access:
Will my account be opted-out of Ratings and Reviews by default?
Yes - when Jane made ratings and reviews available to all clinics, clinics will have the feature disabled by default. You will need to actively enable it via Settings > Ratings & Reviews.
One thing to mention is that all existing patients will be opted-in to the Ratings & Review email ‚Äì however, the email
will not send
unless the feature has been enabled.
Arriving Appointments
Yikes, I just unarrived - then rearrived the same appointment for a patient. Will they get two surveys?
Jane will not send out a second rating email if one has already gone out. In other words, you will not be able to manually generate a
new
survey by un-arriving then re-arriving an appointment in Jane.
If I arrive an appointment early, will Jane send the survey to the client earlier too?
You can arrive an appointment anytime before the appointment start time and Jane will still wait for 3-hours after the appointment end time to send the survey.
What if I arrive then unarrive a
past
appointment? Is this any different?
Nope! If Jane already sent the Rating email once in the past for the appointment, Jane will not send it again.
Settings for Multi-Practitioner Clinics
If ‚Äúrequest feedback after 5 visits‚Äù is selected, and if the patient sees multiple practitioners at the clinic, does Jane know the difference between visit #5 with Practitioner A vs. Practitioner B?
Absolutely! Jane counts visits with the selected practitioner and the specific treatment. So the number of visits for patient Z with Practitioner A and Practitioner B could be different, and the survey will send out according to this set-up.
If ‚ÄúRequest Visit after First Visit‚Äù is selected, does Jane know that it is a unique first appointment with Practitioner A vs. Practitioner B?
You got it! Jane knows to look at the first treatment with the specific Practitioner and that specific treatment type. So, a client could receive two surveys linked to each first visits with Practitioner A, and Practitioner B. This allows each practitioner to know how the patient rated their first experience with them.
Receiving Surveys and Opting-Out
Does the clinic have the option to opt-out a specific patient from receiving Ratings & Reviews from the clinic?
Yes! By default, when creating a new patient, the new patient will be
opted-in
to receive Ratings & Reviews emails. This can be turned off administratively by clicking
Edit / Settings
within the patient‚Äôs profile, and
unchecking
the *Send Ratings Emails** box.
Do individual patients have the option to opt-out of receiving Ratings & Reviews emails?
Individual patients can opt-out of receiving these emails. In their
My Account
, they have an option to
uncheck
the option for
I would like to provide my feedback on my experience
, under their Notifications & Reminders.
I‚Äôm a guardian/parent of a minor and I‚Äôd like to provide feedback to the clinic for my child‚Äôs appointment. Will I receive this email?
If the guardian/parent is set-up to receive the minor‚Äôs emails & notifications via Jane‚Äôs
Family Relationship
feature, they will also receive the Rating email.
Google Reviews
I have Google Reviews enabled for my clinic. Will Jane automatically help me post my reviews to Google as well?
We wish we could but Google doesn‚Äôt allow any software to post reviews automatically. Google wants users to post their own reviews with their own Google accounts to prevent companies from creating less-than-credible ratings and reviews. They also want to make sure it‚Äôs really you. Imagine if you as a patient found out a practitioner posted a review in your name!
We make it easy for patients to leave a review on Google. Once they complete their star rating, they can simply click to ‚ÄúOpen Google Review‚Äù. This will open your Google Review page for them, all setup ready for their review. To see how that looks, read more about it
in the guide here
.
I‚Äôm a practitioner at a multi-disciplinary clinic. I‚Äôm not allowed to use Google Reviews as per my Regulatory Body‚Äôs Standards of Practice, but others in my clinic are allowed to. What does this mean for our clinic‚Äôs Ratings & Reviews settings?
Google reviews is a
clinic-wide
rule. With this in mind, we‚Äôve put together one scenario and two possible setting options for clinics that may fall under this category.
Scenario: I am a multi-disciplinary clinic with 1 Discipline that is
allowed
to collect external Google Reviews, and 1 Discipline that is
not approved to
.
Settings Option 1
:
Internal Feedback enabled for all practitioners ‚úÖ
External Google Reviews disabled for all practitioners üö´
Settings Option 2
:
Internal Feedback enabled for
only those practitioners who also are approved for Google Reviews
‚úÖ
External Google Reviews enabled ‚úÖ
I‚Äôm using Google Reviews. If a client‚Äôs feedback is posted to Google as well, will the clinic or staff member be notified?
You‚Äôll be able to see when a patient has clicked the ‚ÄúRate Your Experience‚Äù survey from the patient
Communications
tab, however, we don‚Äôt know if they‚Äôve actually left a review in Google.
Looking at Google will always be the best option albeit you won‚Äôt be able to see if the patient came directly from Jane. This is a development we may look into in the future based on clinic feedback.
Can I customize my text so that my patient can read my personalized note before proceeding to post on Google?
Yes, you now have two customization options! 1. For ratings between 1-3, and 2. For ratings between 4-5.
You can find the customization under
Settings > Ratings & Reviews
or
via Settings > Language
Here‚Äôs the location of this customized text:
If I have Google Reviews enabled, does my client get prompted to leave a review for any star rating from 1-5?
Yes
, Google now requires that any star rating (between 1-5) prompts a Google Review, so we have now gone ahead and implemented this change in Jane. It‚Äôs a change that Google made to increase the authenticity and trust of Google Reviews (which is a good thing for all of us consumers!).
If Google thinks that we are only sending over positive reviews from Jane, then Google can pull those reviews off of your business listing and block Jane as a referrer of reviews.
Does my regulatory body allow me to publicly market patient testimonials online?
Jane is working hard on creating a region-specific list with some easy to digest information based on different regulatory bodys‚Äô marketing standards.
We are not lawyers nor are we equipped to interpret licensing regulations and bylaws. You should confirm with your regulating body that our summary of the regulations linked below are accurate.
We‚Äôll be starting with Canada (BC, AB, ON). However, we do want to emphasize that if there is any uncertainty, please do get in touch with your regulatory body directly to get a more definite answer. And as always, we‚Äôd love to hear from you to see what resolution was reached so that we can update this guide document accordingly.
British Columbia
Discipline
Can I use Google Reviews?
Standards of Practice
Naturopathic Doctors
No
Link
Registered Massage Therapist
Possibly
Link
Chiropractor
Yes
Link
Physiotherapist
Possibly
Link
Acupuncture
Possibly. Please refer to pages 48-50 of the bylaws, which indicate
      practitioners need to watch the content of the reviews closely.
Link
Counsellor
Unlikely, due to association requirements. Please check with your registration body.
Link
Psychologist
No
Link
Social Workers
No
Link
Alberta
Discipline
Can I use Google Reviews?
Standards of Practice
Naturopathic Doctors
Possibly. Within the Standards of Practice, there is no reference to
      prompting patients for testimonials.
Link
Registered Massage Therapist
Yes
Link
Chiropractor
Yes
Link
Physiotherapist
Possibly. The Standards of Practice indicates that practitioners need to
      watch the content of the reviews closely to ensure they are represented
      accurately online.
Link
Acupuncture
Possibly. Within the Standards of Practice, there is no reference to
      prompting patients for testimonials.
Link
Counsellor
No
Link

No
Link

Discipline
Can I use Google Reviews?
Standards of Practice
Naturopathic Doctors
No
Link
Registered Massage Therapist

Link

No
Link

Link
Acupuncture

Link
Counsellor

Link
Psychologist
No
CPO Link
OAMHP Link
General
Why didn‚Äôt my patient receive a Ratings email?
Sorting out why a ratings and review email wasn‚Äôt sent can be a bit tricky at first but there are specific conditions where Jane won‚Äôt send the notification out. Here are some reasons why:
The patient‚Äôs appointment was not marked as
Arrived
(this includes No Show, cancelled/deleted, and unarrived appointments as Jane won‚Äôt send a Ratings email for an appointment that did not occur)
The patient‚Äôs is arrived
after
the calendar date of the appointment. For example, if an appointment is booked for August 18th, but is not marked as arrived until  August 19th, then Jane will not send out a notification.
The patient has ‚ÄúDo Not Email‚Äù selected in their profile
The patient has opted out of Ratings emails in their My Account
The patient has no email address or an invalid email
The practitioner is not opted into the clinic‚Äôs Ratings and Reviews settings.
Can I manually send a ratings email to a patient?
No
, at the moment there isn‚Äôt a way to manually resend these emails to clients and are only automatically prompted after the appointment is marked as arrived.
Additional Resources
If you haven‚Äôt seen them already, we have a handful of ratings & reviews guides on several topics:
How to Setup Ratings & Reviews
Review Your Ratings (for Practitioners)
Filling out a Rating Survey (for Patients)
Setting up your location for Google Reviews
As always, we love hearing from you!
You can reach out to us here
.
Subscribe to our monthly newsletter.

Patient Feedback
Ratings & Reviews FAQs
23 min read
Thrive PlanThis guide is a compilation of some of the most frequently asked questions around Jane‚Äôs Ratings & Reviews feature. Have a read through these, and stay tuned for some links at the bottom of this Guide to some additional resources to help you get set up and on your way with Ratings and Reviews.
Access and Permissions
What access level is required to enable Ratings and Reviews?
Do all staff members have permission to see practitioners‚Äô internal ratings and reviews?
Will my account be opted-out of Ratings and Reviews by default?
Arriving Appointments
Yikes, I just unarrived - then rearrived the same appointment for a patient. Will they get two surveys?
If I arrive an appointment early, will Jane send the survey to the client earlier too?
What if I arrive then unarrive a
past
appointment? Is this any different?
Settings for Multi-Practitioner Clinics
If ‚Äúrequest feedback after 5 visits‚Äù is selected, and if the patient sees multiple practitioners at the clinic, does Jane know the difference between visit #5 with Practitioner A vs. Practitioner B?
If ‚ÄúRequest Visit after Initial Visit‚Äù is selected, does Jane know that it is a unique initial visit with Practitioner A vs. Practitioner B?
Receiving Surveys and Opting-Out
Does the clinic have the option to opt-out a specific patient from receiving surveys from the clinic?
Do individual patients have the option to opt-out of receiving surveys?
I‚Äôm a guardian/parent of a minor and I‚Äôd like to provide feedback to the clinic for my child‚Äôs appointment. Will I receive this email?
Google Reviews
I have Google Reviews enabled for my clinic. Will Jane automatically help me post my reviews to Google as well?
I‚Äôm a practitioner at a multi-disciplinary clinic. I‚Äôm not allowed to use Google Reviews as per my Regulatory Body‚Äôs Standards of Practice, but others in my clinic are allowed to. What does this mean for our clinic‚Äôs Ratings & Reviews settings?
I‚Äôm using Google Reviews. If a client‚Äôs feedback is posted to Google as well, will the clinic or staff member be notified?
Can I customize my text so that my patient can read my personalized note before proceeding to post on Google?
If I have Google Reviews enabled, does my client get prompted to leave a review for any star rating from 1-5?
Does my regulatory body allow me to publicly market patient testimonials online?
General
Why didn‚Äôt my patient receive a Ratings email?
Can I manually send a rating email to a patient?
Access and Permissions
What access level is required to enable Ratings and Reviews?
You‚Äôll need to be the Account Owner or have Full Access to enable Ratings & Reviews within Settings.
Do all staff members have permission to see practitioners‚Äô internal ratings and reviews?
Only
Full Access & Administrative/All Billing
have access to see each staff member‚Äôs ratings and reviews at the clinic. Here‚Äôs a nifty little table we put together to display the Role and Access:
Will my account be opted-out of Ratings and Reviews by default?
Yes - when Jane made ratings and reviews available to all clinics, clinics will have the feature disabled by default. You will need to actively enable it via Settings > Ratings & Reviews.
One thing to mention is that all existing patients will be opted-in to the Ratings & Review email ‚Äì however, the email
will not send
unless the feature has been enabled.
Arriving Appointments
Yikes, I just unarrived - then rearrived the same appointment for a patient. Will they get two surveys?
Jane will not send out a second rating email if one has already gone out. In other words, you will not be able to manually generate a
new
survey by un-arriving then re-arriving an appointment in Jane.
If I arrive an appointment early, will Jane send the survey to the client earlier too?
You can arrive an appointment anytime before the appointment start time and Jane will still wait for 3-hours after the appointment end time to send the survey.
What if I arrive then unarrive a
past
appointment? Is this any different?
Nope! If Jane already sent the Rating email once in the past for the appointment, Jane will not send it again.
Settings for Multi-Practitioner Clinics
If ‚Äúrequest feedback after 5 visits‚Äù is selected, and if the patient sees multiple practitioners at the clinic, does Jane know the difference between visit #5 with Practitioner A vs. Practitioner B?
Absolutely! Jane counts visits with the selected practitioner and the specific treatment. So the number of visits for patient Z with Practitioner A and Practitioner B could be different, and the survey will send out according to this set-up.
If ‚ÄúRequest Visit after First Visit‚Äù is selected, does Jane know that it is a unique first appointment with Practitioner A vs. Practitioner B?
You got it! Jane knows to look at the first treatment with the specific Practitioner and that specific treatment type. So, a client could receive two surveys linked to each first visits with Practitioner A, and Practitioner B. This allows each practitioner to know how the patient rated their first experience with them.
Receiving Surveys and Opting-Out
Does the clinic have the option to opt-out a specific patient from receiving Ratings & Reviews from the clinic?
Yes! By default, when creating a new patient, the new patient will be
opted-in
to receive Ratings & Reviews emails. This can be turned off administratively by clicking
Edit / Settings
within the patient‚Äôs profile, and
unchecking
the *Send Ratings Emails** box.
Do individual patients have the option to opt-out of receiving Ratings & Reviews emails?
Individual patients can opt-out of receiving these emails. In their
My Account
, they have an option to
uncheck
the option for
I would like to provide my feedback on my experience
, under their Notifications & Reminders.
I‚Äôm a guardian/parent of a minor and I‚Äôd like to provide feedback to the clinic for my child‚Äôs appointment. Will I receive this email?
If the guardian/parent is set-up to receive the minor‚Äôs emails & notifications via Jane‚Äôs
Family Relationship
feature, they will also receive the Rating email.
Google Reviews
I have Google Reviews enabled for my clinic. Will Jane automatically help me post my reviews to Google as well?
We wish we could but Google doesn‚Äôt allow any software to post reviews automatically. Google wants users to post their own reviews with their own Google accounts to prevent companies from creating less-than-credible ratings and reviews. They also want to make sure it‚Äôs really you. Imagine if you as a patient found out a practitioner posted a review in your name!
We make it easy for patients to leave a review on Google. Once they complete their star rating, they can simply click to ‚ÄúOpen Google Review‚Äù. This will open your Google Review page for them, all setup ready for their review. To see how that looks, read more about it
in the guide here
.
I‚Äôm a practitioner at a multi-disciplinary clinic. I‚Äôm not allowed to use Google Reviews as per my Regulatory Body‚Äôs Standards of Practice, but others in my clinic are allowed to. What does this mean for our clinic‚Äôs Ratings & Reviews settings?
Google reviews is a
clinic-wide
rule. With this in mind, we‚Äôve put together one scenario and two possible setting options for clinics that may fall under this category.
Scenario: I am a multi-disciplinary clinic with 1 Discipline that is
allowed
to collect external Google Reviews, and 1 Discipline that is
not approved to
.
Settings Option 1
:
Internal Feedback enabled for all practitioners ‚úÖ
External Google Reviews disabled for all practitioners üö´
Settings Option 2
:
Internal Feedback enabled for
only those practitioners who also are approved for Google Reviews
‚úÖ
External Google Reviews enabled ‚úÖ
I‚Äôm using Google Reviews. If a client‚Äôs feedback is posted to Google as well, will the clinic or staff member be notified?
You‚Äôll be able to see when a patient has clicked the ‚ÄúRate Your Experience‚Äù survey from the patient
Communications
tab, however, we don‚Äôt know if they‚Äôve actually left a review in Google.
Looking at Google will always be the best option albeit you won‚Äôt be able to see if the patient came directly from Jane. This is a development we may look into in the future based on clinic feedback.
Can I customize my text so that my patient can read my personalized note before proceeding to post on Google?
Yes, you now have two customization options! 1. For ratings between 1-3, and 2. For ratings between 4-5.
You can find the customization under
Settings > Ratings & Reviews
or
via Settings > Language
Here‚Äôs the location of this customized text:
If I have Google Reviews enabled, does my client get prompted to leave a review for any star rating from 1-5?
Yes
, Google now requires that any star rating (between 1-5) prompts a Google Review, so we have now gone ahead and implemented this change in Jane. It‚Äôs a change that Google made to increase the authenticity and trust of Google Reviews (which is a good thing for all of us consumers!).
If Google thinks that we are only sending over positive reviews from Jane, then Google can pull those reviews off of your business listing and block Jane as a referrer of reviews.
Does my regulatory body allow me to publicly market patient testimonials online?
Jane is working hard on creating a region-specific list with some easy to digest information based on different regulatory bodys‚Äô marketing standards.
We are not lawyers nor are we equipped to interpret licensing regulations and bylaws. You should confirm with your regulating body that our summary of the regulations linked below are accurate.
We‚Äôll be starting with Canada (BC, AB, ON). However, we do want to emphasize that if there is any uncertainty, please do get in touch with your regulatory body directly to get a more definite answer. And as always, we‚Äôd love to hear from you to see what resolution was reached so that we can update this guide document accordingly.

General
Why didn‚Äôt my patient receive a Ratings email?
Sorting out why a ratings and review email wasn‚Äôt sent can be a bit tricky at first but there are specific conditions where Jane won‚Äôt send the notification out. Here are some reasons why:
The patient‚Äôs appointment was not marked as
Arrived
(this includes No Show, cancelled/deleted, and unarrived appointments as Jane won‚Äôt send a Ratings email for an appointment that did not occur)
The patient‚Äôs is arrived
after
the calendar date of the appointment. For example, if an appointment is booked for August 18th, but is not marked as arrived until  August 19th, then Jane will not send out a notification.
The patient has ‚ÄúDo Not Email‚Äù selected in their profile
The patient has opted out of Ratings emails in their My Account
The patient has no email address or an invalid email
The practitioner is not opted into the clinic‚Äôs Ratings and Reviews settings.
Can I manually send a ratings email to a patient?
No
, at the moment there isn‚Äôt a way to manually resend these emails to clients and are only automatically prompted after the appointment is marked as arrived.
